Fallout 3
Vault-Tec engineers have worked around the clock on an interactive reproduction of Wasteland life for you to enjoy from the comfort of your own vault. Included is an expansive world, unique combat, shockingly realistic visuals, tons of player choice, and an incredible cast of dynamic characters.

About This Game

Vault-Tec engineers have worked around the clock on an interactive reproduction of Wasteland life for you to enjoy from the comfort of your own vault. Included is an expansive world, unique combat, shockingly realistic visuals, tons of player choice, and an incredible cast of dynamic characters. Every minute is a fight for survival against the terrors of the outside world — radiation, Super Mutants, and hostile mutated creatures. From Vault-Tec, America's First Choice in Post Nuclear Simulation.
  • Limitless Freedom! Take in the sights and sounds of the vast Capital Wasteland! See the great monuments of the United States lying in post-apocalyptic ruin! You make the choices that define you and change the world. Just keep an eye on your Rad Meter!
  • Experience S.P.E.C.I.A.L.! Vault-Tec engineers bring you the latest in human ability simulation — the SPECIAL Character System! Utilizing new breakthroughs in points-based ability representation, SPECIAL affords unlimited customization of your character. Also included are dozens of unique skills and perks to choose from, each with a dazzling variety of effects!
  • Fantastic New Views! The wizards at Vault-Tec have done it again! No longer constrained to just one view, experience the world from 1st or 3rd person perspective. Customize your view with the touch of a button!
  • The Power of Choice! Feeling like a dastardly villain today, or a Good Samaritan? Pick a side or walk the line, as every situation can be dealt with in many different ways. Talk out your problems in a civilized fashion, or just flash your Plasma Rifle.
  • Blast 'Em Away With V.A.T.S.! Even the odds in combat with the Vault-Tec Assisted Targeting System for your Pip-Boy Model 3000! V.A.T.S. allows you to pause time in combat, target specific body parts on your target, queue up attacks, and let Vault-Tec take out your aggression for you. Rain death and destruction in an all-new cinematic presentation.
  • Mind-Blowing Artificial Intelligence! At Vault-Tec, we realize that the key to reviving civilization after a global nuclear war is people. Our best minds pooled their efforts to produce an advanced version of Radiant AI, America's First Choice in Human Interaction Simulation. Facial expressions, gestures, unique dialog, and lifelike behavior are brought together with stunning results by the latest in Vault-Tec technology.
  • Eye-Popping Prettiness!*: Witness the harsh realities of nuclear fallout rendered like never before in modern super-deluxe HD graphics. From the barren Wasteland, to the danger-filled offices and metro tunnels of DC, to the hideous rotten flesh of a mutant's face.
    *Protective Eyewear Encouraged.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • Operating system: Windows XP/Vista
    • Processor: 2.4 Ghz Intel Pentium 4 or equivalent processor
    • Memory: 1 GB (XP)/ 2 GB (Vista)
    • Hard disk space: 7 GB
    • Video: Direct X 9.0c compliant video card with 256MB RAM (NVIDIA 6800 or better/ATI X850 or better)
    • Sound: DirectX®: 9.0c
    • Controller support: Xbox 360 controller
    • Other Requirements: Online play requires log-in to Games For Windows - Live
    Supported Video Card Chipsets:
    • NVIDIA GeForce 200 series, Geforce 9800 series, Geforce 9600 series, Geforce 8800 series, Geforce 8600 series, Geforce 8500 series, Geforce 8400 series, Geforce 7900 series, Geforce 7800 series, Geforce 7600 series, Geforce 7300 series, GeForce 6800 series
    • ATI HD 4800 series, HD 4600 series, HD 3800 series, HD 3600 series, HD 3400 series, HD 2900 series, HD 2600 series, HD 2400 series, X1900 series, X1800 series, X1600 series, X1300 series, X850 series
    Recommended:
    • Operating system: Windows XP/Vista
    • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo processor
    • Memory: 2 GB System RAM
    • Hard disk space: 7 GB
    • Video: Direct X 9.0c compliant video card with 512MB RAM (NVIDIA 8800 series, ATI 3800 series)
    • Sound: DirectX®: 9.0c
    • Controller support: Xbox 360 controller

A French School Girl
257 products in account
15 reviews
Recommended
159.9 hrs on record
Posted: June 4
Don't lie. You're reading these reviews to build your hype for Fallout 4 for some reason. It's okay, I am too.

EDIT 11/10/2015: You know what day it is right? Like, why are you reading this?






P.S. Because I'm getting messages and comments from people saying "Can I play this on Win 7???" I'm just gonna list out the fixes required to make sure it runs just like it would on Vista (but better because you know, you're running 7 for a reason).

1. Crash/Freezing issue at random points in the game:

-Run the game at least once

-Go here ( C:\Users\[Username]\Documents\My Games\Fallout3\Fallout.ini )

-Press "Ctrl+F" type (without quotation marks) "bUseThreadedAI"

-Should read "bUseThreadedAI=0", change the 0 to 1 (if this line isn't there, add it anywhere in the
block of lines above the [Display] category of the file)

-(This next line shouldn't be in your file already but do a quick Ctrl+F to make sure, if it is change
it accordingly)

-Directly underneath "bUseThreadedAI=1", write "iNumHWThreads=2". If it's already there, just
change whatever value it is to "2".

Save & Exit



2. Radio Music Stuttering

Preface: Now even with this fix in place, I still find occasional bouts where either music will not
play from my Pip-Boy or the stuttering will return in a certain area for some odd reason.
This is just a general fix that will help alleviate stuttering for ~95% of your game time.

-Download MADFilter
( http://sourceforge.net/projects/maddxshow/files/MAD%20Filter/MADFilter%201.0.0.3/ )

-Extract "MADFilter.ax", "register.bat" and "unregister.bat" file to ( C:\Windows\SysWOW64 for
64-bit OS's or C:\Windows\system for 32-bit OS's)

-Once you've extracted the files to your directory, run the register.bat that is currently in your
SysWOW64 or system folder.

-Just to make sure you did the work correctly, download "InstalledCodec"
( http://www.nirsoft.net/utils/installedcodec.zip ), extract the zip and run the .exe once extracted

-Look for "MAD Transform Filter" and make sure it's installed. THEN, find "Fraunhofer IIS MPEG
Layer-3 Codec" in the utility. Right click it and select "Disable Selected Items"

Run the game and on your pip-boy radio, select Galaxy News radio and listen to see if the
stuttering is still there. If it is, then you should go back and check which directory you pasted
the MADFilter file into and check InstalledCodec to ensure the MAD filter is installed and enabled
and then make sure the Fraunhofer codec is DISABLED. If this didn't work, there is a conflict
within your codecs and you may have another MP3 Codec installed and working on top of your
MAD Filter. I'd check InstalledCodec and see what may be conflicting.

Credit to GoldenShadow for helping me fix this years ago
( http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=844931 )



3. Random Crashes and Freezing fix AFTER the Fallout.ini fix:

This little guy over at Nexus may have a fix for you. If you're still crashing and freezing and have
no clue why, try downloading his d3d9.dll file and insert it into your game's source directory.

Download link: ( http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout3/mods/18900/? )

(If you're in the same boat as myself and still have random crashes, freezes and all sorts of odd
mishaps in your game and you've done all of the fixes listed above, I'm afraid I have no other help
considering I've dug pretty far to find some other fixes and nothing has really helped. Best to just
Quicksave (F5 by default) as often as possible)


P.P.S. Edited for Win 8 & 8.1 compatibility fixes

(The following is provided thanks to the very generous blue_light1554)

1. Basically, if your computer has two cores, you have to follow French Girls' steps for only "1. Crash/Freezing issue at random points in the game:"

2. Save the modified notepad text and exit.

3. Then you put compatibility mode: Windows XP Service Pack 3
You do that for "Fallout 3 Launcher" and the application named "Fallout 3".
(...\Steam\Steamapps\Common\Fallout 3)

4. Then visit this website: http://www.xbox.com/en-US/live/pc/DownloadClient
This will make you download a missing client required to make Fallout 3 work.

5. When you've done all that, you right click on the Fallout 3 application and do "Run as Administrator"

6. It should work!

7. I'm not an expert so if you have questions or it didn't work for you, go see the website shown here: http://help.bethsoft.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/9977

Maybe you'll find something else useful.

EDIT 11/6/2013: I just upgrade from Win 7 to Win 10 and I can confirm Fallout 3 runs fine on the same exact system I did an entire playthrough on. Loaded it up and ran around a bit and it played just like it did on 7.

You can make a giant bomb explode.
You can kill everybody, good or bad, and get your karma according to the things you do.
You can listen to some radio classics while killing everybody.
You can read books in less than a second.
You can hack things like the vast majority of people think every CS:GO player does.
Did I mention you can kill everybody?

11/10
